title.narrative: F.a: Implementation of ILO Convention 151 in the Philippines

description.narrative: The project supports the implementation of the ILO Convention 151 and the regulation of the enabling laws in the Philippines. For this, public sector trade unions will have legal and technical support from labour legislation advisors. In addition, the proj ect will provide training to trade unions on advocacy skills and capacity to monitor and guide the implementation of Convention 151 on workplace level. Interest representation of public sector workers in the Philippines has been difficult, since their righ ts to organise have been almost non-existent. Due to privatization and outsourcing of public services the state administration and public services workers´ situation and rights have weakened, and without an official recognition, the strikes and collective bargaining are ineffective and even illegal. In 2013-2015 PSI together with its affiliates and SASK implemented a project, which aimed at ratifying the right to organise and negotiate for public sector workers in Philippines. received. The ratification di d not succeed, but a new campaign, based on a new strategy, was implemented in 2017. In August 2017, Philippines was the first Asian country to ratify the ILO Convention 151. This was an extremely significant victory for the trade union movement of the Ph ilippines. The ratification of ILO Convention 151 will significantly improve the public sector workers´ situation and collective bargaining rights in the Philippines. The challenge for the trade union movement after the successful ratification will be the inclusion of the Convention into the national legislation through enabling laws and its implementation on workplace level. The beneficiaries are public sector workers and trade unions in the Philippines. The project is implemented by Public Services Inter national (PSI) and its member unions in the Philippines.
